original: Majjhima Nikāya 53
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Sayings 53

original: Sekhasutta
analyzed: sekhasutta
translated: Middle Length Discourses 🔽With a Learner

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṁ nigrodhārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmin nigrodha ārāme
translated: Once the Buddha was staying in the Sakyan country, at Kapilavatthu in the Banyan Tree Monastery.

original: Tena kho pana samayena kāpilavatthavānaṁ sakyānaṁ navaṁ santhāgāraṁ acirakāritaṁ hoti anajjhāvuṭṭhaṁ samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā kenaci vā manussabhūtena.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena kāpilavatthavānam sakyānam navam santhāgāram acira kāritam hoti an ajjhāvuṭṭham samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā kenacid vā manussa bhūtena
translated: Now at that time a new assembly hall had just been built for the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu, and it had not yet been lived in by any monastic or brahmin or any human being at all.

original: Atha kho kāpilavatthavā sakyā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ🔽abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho kāpilavatthavā sakyā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: atha khalu kāpilavatthavāḥ sakyāḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamiṣu upasaṅkamitvā bhagavanta  abhivādetvā ekamantam ekamantam nisīdisu ekamantam nisinnāḥ kho kāpilavatthavāḥ sakyāḥ bhagavantam etat avocuḥ
translated: Then the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu went to the Buddha,

original: “idha, bhante, kāpilavatthavānaṁ sakyānaṁ navaṁ santhāgāraṁ acirakāritaṁ anajjhāvuṭṭhaṁ samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā kenaci vā manussabhūtena.
analyzed: idha bhante kāpilavatthavānam sakyānam navam santhāgāram acira kāritam an ajjhāvuṭṭham samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā kenacid vā manussa bhūtena
translated: bowed, sat down, and said, “Sir, a new assembly hall has just been built for the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu, and it has not yet been lived in by any monastic or brahmin or any human being at all.

original: Taṁ, bhante, bhagavā paṭhamaṁ paribhuñjatu. Bhagavatā paṭhamaṁ paribhuttaṁ pacchā kāpilavatthavā sakyā paribhuñjissanti.
analyzed: ta bhante bhagavā paṭhamam paribhuñjatu bhagavatā paṭhamam paribhuttam pacchā kāpilavatthavā sakyā paribhuñjissanti
translated: Let the Blessed One make use of it first. After the Blessed One has made use of it, the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu will make use of it.

original: Tadassa kāpilavatthavānaṁ sakyānaṁ dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāyā”ti.
analyzed: tat assa kāpilavatthavānam sakyānam dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya ati
translated: That will be for the long-term benefit & happiness of the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu.”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.🔽Atha kho kāpilavatthavā sakyā bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena  atha khalu kāpilavatthavāḥ sakyāḥ bhagavataḥ adhivāsanam viditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavanta
translated: The Blessed One acquiesced with silence.

original: abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā yena navaṁ santhāgāraṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā
analyzed: abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā yena navam santhāgāram tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā
translated: Then the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu, understanding that with his silence the Blessed One had acquiesced, got up from their seats, bowed down to him, circumambulated him, keeping him to their right, and went to the new assembly hall. On arrival,

original: sabbasanthariṁ santhāgāraṁ santharitvā āsanāni paññapetvā udakamaṇikaṁ upaṭṭhapetvā
analyzed: sabba santharim santhāgāram santharitvā āsanāni paññapetvā udaka maṇikam upaṭṭhapetvā
translated: they spread it all over with felt rugs, arranged seats, set out a water vessel, and raised an oil lamp.

original: telappadīpaṁ āropetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu;🔽upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu.
analyzed: telappadīpam āropetvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamisu  upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhasu
translated: Then they went to the Blessed One and, on arrival, having bowed down to him, stood to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho kāpilavatthavā sakyā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: eka mantam ṭhitāḥ kho kāpilavatthavāḥ sakyāḥ bhagavantam etat avocuḥ
translated: As they were standing there they said to him, “Lord, the new assembly hall has been covered all over with felt rugs, seats have been arranged, a water vessel has been set out, and an oil lamp raised.

original: “sabbasanthariṁ santhataṁ, bhante, santhāgāraṁ, āsanāni paññattāni, udakamaṇiko upaṭṭhāpito, telappadīpo āropito.
analyzed: sabbasantharim santhata bhante santhāgāre āsanāni paññattāni udaka maṇikaḥ upaṭṭhāpito tela ppadīpaḥ āropito
translated: “The rest-house, Sir, is completely covered. The seats are prepared. The water-pot is set out, and a lamp is lit.

original: Yassadāni, bhante, bhagavā kālaṁ maññatī”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ sadāni bhante bhagavā kālam maññati iti
translated: Now it’s time for you to do as you think fit.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena yena santhāgāraṁ🔽tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā pāde pakkhāletvā santhāgāraṁ pavisitvā majjhimaṁ thambhaṁ
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena yena santhāgāra  tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā pāde pakkhāletvā santhāgāram pavisitvā majjhimam thambha
translated: The Buddha then robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to the rest-house together with the Sangha of monks.

original: nissāya puratthābhimukho nisīdi.🔽Bhikkhusaṅghopi kho pāde pakkhāletvā santhāgāraṁ pavisitvā pacchimaṁ bhittiṁ nissāya puratthābhimukho nisīdi, bhagavantaṁyeva purakkhatvā.
analyzed: nissāya purattha abhimukhaḥ nisīdi  bhikkhu saṅghaḥ api kho pāde pakkhāletvā santhāgāram pavisitvā pacchimam bhittim nissāya purattha abhimukhaḥ nisīdi bhagavantayā iva purakkhatvā
translated: He washed his feet, entered the rest-house, and sat down against the central column facing east.🔽The Sangha of monks washed their feet, entered the rest-house, and sat down against the western wall facing east, with the Buddha in front of them.

original: Kāpilavatthavāpi kho sakyā pāde pakkhāletvā santhāgāraṁ pavisitvā puratthimaṁ bhittiṁ nissāya pacchimābhimukhā nisīdiṁsu, bhagavantaṁyeva purakkhatvā.
analyzed: kāpilavatthavāpi kho sakyā pāde pakkhāletvā santhāgāram pavisitvā puratthimam bhittim nissāya pacchima abhimukhāḥ nisīdisu bhagavantayā iva purakkhatvā
translated: The Sakyans of Kapilavatthu washed their feet, entered the rest-house, and sat down against the eastern wall facing west, with the Buddha in front of them.

original: Atha kho bhagavā kāpilavatthave sakye bahudeva rattiṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā kāpilavatthave sakye bahudeva rattim dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahasetvā āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: Then the Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu with a teaching. He then said to Venerable Ānanda,

original: “paṭibhātu taṁ, ānanda, kāpilavatthavānaṁ sakyānaṁ sekho pāṭipado.
analyzed: paṭibhātu te ānanda kāpilavatthavānam sakyānam sekhaḥ pāṭipadaḥ
translated: “Ānanda, please give the training and the instructions to the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu.

original: Piṭṭhi me āgilāyati;
analyzed: piṭṭhi me āgilāyati
translated: My back is aching.

original: tamahaṁ āyamissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tam aham āyamissāmi iti
translated: I’ll stretch it.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ paccassosi
translated: “Yes, Sir.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā catugguṇaṁ saṅghāṭiṁ paññāpetvā dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṁ kappesi, pāde pādaṁ accādhāya, sato sampajāno, uṭṭhānasaññaṁ manasi karitvā.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā catugguṇam saṅghāṭim paññāpetvā dakkhiṇena passena sīha seyyam kappesi pāde pādam accādhāya sataḥ sampajānaḥ uṭṭhāna saññam manasi karitvā
translated: The Buddha then folded his outer robe in four and lay down on his right side, placing one foot on top of the other, mindful and clearly aware, after noting in his mind the time for rising.

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando mahānāmaṁ sakkaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ mahānāmam sakkam āmantesi
translated: Ānanda then said to Mahānāma,🔽“Mahānāma, a noble disciple who has virtue,🔽who guards the sense doors,

original: “idha, mahānāma, ariyasāvako sīlasampanno hoti, indriyesu guttadvāro hoti, bhojane
analyzed: idha mahānāma ariya sāvako sīla sampanno hoti indriyesu gutta dvāraḥ hoti bhojane
translated: who is moderate in eating,🔽who is devoted to wakefulness,

original: mattaññū hoti, jāgariyaṁ anuyutto hoti, sattahi saddhammehi samannāgato hoti, catunnaṁ
analyzed: mattaññū hoti jāgariyam anuyuttaḥ hoti sattahi saddhammehi samannāgataḥ hoti catunna
translated: who has seven good qualities,🔽and who has four other qualities is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the lower world, fixed in destiny, heading for enlightenment.

original: jhānānaṁ ābhicetasikānaṁ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṁ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
analyzed: jhānānam ābhicetasikānam diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihārānam nikāma lābhī hoti a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī
translated: he attains the various insights and the various deliverances, and he achieves the various supernormal powers.

original: Kathañca, mahānāma, ariyasāvako sīlasampanno hoti?
analyzed: kathañca mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ sīla sampannaḥ hoti
translated: “And how, Mahanama, is a noble disciple perfected in morality?

original: Idha, mahānāma, ariyasāvako sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṁvarasaṁvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.
analyzed: idha mahānāma ariya sāvako sīlavā hoti pātimokkha savara savutaḥ viharati ācāra gocara sampannaḥ aṇumattesu vajjesu bhaya dassāvī samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu
translated: Here, Mahanama, a noble disciple is virtuous, he dwells restrained with the restraint of the Patimokkha, he is perfect in conduct and resort, and seeing fear in the slightest fault, he trains by undertaking the training precepts.

original: Evaṁ kho, mahānāma, ariyasāvako sīlasampanno hoti.
analyzed: evam kho mahānāma ariya sāvako sīla sampannaḥ hoti
translated: It is in this way, Mahanama, that a noble disciple is perfected in morality.

original: Kathañca, mahānāma, ariyasāvako indriyesu guttadvāro hoti?
analyzed: kathañca mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ indriyesu gutta dvāraḥ hoti
translated: “And how, Mahanama, is a noble disciple guarded in the doors of his sense faculties?

original: Idha, mahānāma, ariyasāvako cakkhunā rūpaṁ disvā na nimittaggāhī hoti nānubyañjanaggāhī.🔽Yatvādhikaraṇamenaṁ cakkhundriyaṁ asaṁvutaṁ viharantaṁ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā
analyzed: idha mahānāma ariya sāvako cakkhunā rūpam disvā na nimitta ggāhī hoti na anubyañjana ggāhī  yatvā adhikaraṇam enam cakkhu indriyam asavutam viharantam abhijjhā domanassā pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ
translated: Here, Mahanama, having seen a form with the eye, a noble disciple does not grasp at its signs and features.

original: dhammā anvāssaveyyuṁ tassa saṁvarāya paṭipajjati, rakkhati cakkhundriyaṁ, cakkhundriye saṁvaraṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: dhammāḥ anvāssaveyyum tassa savarāya paṭipajjati rakkhati cakkhu indriya cakkhu indriye savaram āpajjati
translated: Since, if he were to dwell without guarding the faculty of the eye, evil unwholesome states of covetousness and grief might invade him, he practises the way of its restraint, he guards the faculty of the eye, he achieves restraint of the faculty of the eye.

original: Sotena saddaṁ sutvā …pe…🔽ghānena gandhaṁ ghāyitvā …pe…
analyzed: sotena saddam sutvā pe  ghānena gandham ghāyitvā pe
translated: Having heard a sound with the ear…🔽Having smelled an odor with the nose…

original: jivhāya rasaṁ sāyitvā …pe…
analyzed: jivhāya rasam sāyitvā pe
translated: Having tasted a taste with the tongue…

original: kāyena phoṭṭhabbaṁ phusitvā …pe…
analyzed: kāyena phoṭṭhabbam phusitvā pe
translated: Having felt a tactile object with the body…

original: manasā dhammaṁ viññāya na nimittaggāhī hoti nānubyañjanaggāhī.
analyzed: manasā dhammam viññāya na nimitta ggāhī hoti na anubyañjana ggāhī
translated: Having cognized a mental phenomenon with the mind, he does not grasp its signs and features.

original: Yatvādhikaraṇamenaṁ manindriyaṁ asaṁvutaṁ viharantaṁ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā
analyzed: yatvā adhikaraṇam enam man indriyam viharantam abhijjhā domanassā pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ
translated: If he were to leave the mind faculty unguarded, evil unwholesome states of longing and dejection might invade him.

original: dhammā anvāssaveyyuṁ tassa saṁvarāya paṭipajjati, rakkhati manindriyaṁ, manindriye saṁvaraṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: dhammāḥ anvāssaveyyum tassa savarāya paṭipajjati rakkhati manindriya manindriye savaram āpajjati
translated: For this reason he enters upon the way of its restraint, he guards the mind faculty, he undertakes the restraint of the mind faculty.

original: Evaṁ kho, mahānāma, ariyasāvako indriyesu guttadvāro hoti.
analyzed: evam kho mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ indriyesu gutta dvāraḥ hoti
translated: It is in this way that a noble disciple guards the doors of the sense faculties.

original: Kathañca, mahānāma, ariyasāvako bhojane mattaññū hoti?
analyzed: kathañca mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ bhojane mattaññū hoti
translated: “And how, Mahanama, is a noble disciple moderate in eating?

original: Idha, mahānāma, ariyasāvako paṭisaṅkhā yoniso āhāraṁ āhāreti:
analyzed: idha mahānāma ariya sāvako āhāram āhāra iti
translated: Here, Mahanama, a noble disciple, considering danger in even a little sin, shuns it,

original: ‘neva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya; yāvadeva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā
analyzed: na iva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya yāvat eva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā
translated: not for the sake of mere health or beauty or strength or pleasure in this life,

original: yāpanāya vihiṁsūparatiyā brahmacariyānuggahāya. Iti purāṇañca vedanaṁ paṭihaṅkhāmi,
analyzed: yāpanāya brahmacariya anuggahāya iti purāṇam ca vedanam paṭihaṅkhāmi
translated: for the support of the life of one who has undertaken rightly, for the support of the holy life. Thus I will ward off old feelings and will not produce new feelings.

original: navañca vedanaṁ na uppādessāmi, yātrā ca me bhavissati anavajjatā ca phāsuvihāro cā’ti.
analyzed: navam ca vedanam na uppādessāmi yātrā ca me bhavissati anavajja tā ca phāsu vihāraḥ ca ati
translated: for the support of the life-continuum, for the ending of discomfort, and for assisting concentration. Thus I will remove old feelings and not give rise to new feelings. I will maintain myself in comfort, without blame, and in a way that is proper.’

original: Evaṁ kho, mahānāma, ariyasāvako bhojane mattaññū hoti.
analyzed: evam kho mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ bhojane mattaññū hoti
translated: In this way, Mahanama, a noble disciple is moderate in eating.

original: Kathañca, mahānāma, ariyasāvako jāgariyaṁ anuyutto hoti?
analyzed: kathañca mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ jāgariyam anuyuttaḥ hoti
translated: “And how, Mahanama, is a noble disciple devoted to wakefulness?

original: Idha, mahānāma, ariyasāvako divasaṁ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṁ parisodheti,🔽rattiyā paṭhamaṁ yāmaṁ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṁ parisodheti,🔽rattiyā majjhimaṁ yāmaṁ dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṁ kappeti, pāde pādaṁ accādhāya, sato sampajāno, uṭṭhānasaññaṁ manasi karitvā,
analyzed: idha mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ divasam caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittam parisodheti  rattiyā paṭhamam yāmam caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittam parisodheti  rattiyāḥ majjhimam yāmam dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyam kappeti pāde pādam accādhāya sataḥ sampajānaḥ uṭṭhāna saññam manasi karitvā
translated: Here, Mahanama, a noble disciple during the day while walking back and forth and sitting down, purifies his mind of obstructive states.🔽During the first watch of the night while walking back and forth and sitting down, he purifies his mind of obstructive states.🔽During the middle watch of the night he lies down on the right side in the lion’s pose with one foot overlapping the other, mindful and fully aware, after noting in his mind the time for rising.

original: rattiyā pacchimaṁ yāmaṁ paccuṭṭhāya caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṁ parisodheti.
analyzed: rattiyā pacchimam yāmam paccuṭṭhāya caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittam parisodheti
translated: After rising, during the third watch of the night while walking back and forth and sitting down, he purifies his mind of obstructive states.

original: Evaṁ kho, mahānāma, ariyasāvako jāgariyaṁ anuyutto hoti.
analyzed: evam kho mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ jāgariyam anuyuttaḥ hoti
translated: That is how a noble disciple is devoted to wakefulness.

original: Kathañca, mahānāma, ariyasāvako sattahi saddhammehi samannāgato hoti?
analyzed: kathañca mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ sattahi saddhammehi samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: “And how, Mahanama, is a noble disciple endowed with seven good qualities?

original: Idha, mahānāma, ariyasāvako saddho hoti, saddahati tathāgatassa bodhiṁ:
analyzed: idha mahānāma ariya sāvako saddhaḥ hoti saddahati tathāgatassa bodhi
translated: Here, Mahanama, a noble disciple is possessed of faith. He has faith in the Tathagata’s enlightenment:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti.🔽Hirimā hoti, hirīyati kāyaduccaritena vacīduccaritena manoduccaritena, hirīyati pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ samāpattiyā.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati  hirimā hoti hirīyati kāya duccaritena vacī duccaritena manaḥ duccaritena hirīyati pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam samāpattiyā
translated: ‘The Blessed One is an Arahant, a Perfectly Enlightened One, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, one who knows the world, an unsurpassed trainer of persons to be tamed, a teacher of devas and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.’🔽He has a sense of shame. He is ashamed of bodily misconduct, verbal misconduct, and mental misconduct; he is ashamed of taking up bad unwholesome qualities.

original: Ottappī hoti, ottappati kāyaduccaritena vacīduccaritena manoduccaritena, ottappati pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ samāpattiyā.
analyzed: ottappī hoti ottappati kāya duccaritena vacī duccaritena manaḥ duccaritena ottappati pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam samāpattiyā
translated: He has a sense of modesty. He is modest about bodily misconduct, verbal misconduct, and mental misconduct; he is modest about taking up bad unwholesome qualities.

original: Bahussuto hoti sutadharo sutasannicayo. Ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā
analyzed: bahu sutaḥ hoti suta dharaḥ suta sannicayaḥ ye te dhammā ādi kalyāṇā majjhe kalyāṇā pariyosāna kalyāṇā
translated: He is learned, remembers what he has learned, and accumulates what he has learned. Those teachings that are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing, which affirm a holy life that is utterly perfect and pure—such teachings as these he hears, learns by heart, and accumulates.

original: sātthā sabyañjanā kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ abhivadanti tathārūpāssa
analyzed: sātthā sa byañjanā kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam abhivadanti tathārūpā sa
translated: the Teacher, the one who has the same qualities, the one who has the same qualities and the same teaching, the one who has the same qualities, the same teaching, and the same way of living, the one who has the same qualities, the same teaching, the same way of living, and the same training, the one who has the same qualities, the same teaching, the same way of living, the same training, and the same practice, the one who has the same qualities, the same teaching, the same way of living, the same training, the same practice, and the same liberation, the one who has the same qualities, the same teaching, the same way of living, the same training, the same practice, the same liberation, and the same wisdom, the one who has the same qualities, the same teaching, the same way of living, the same training, the same practice, the same liberation, the same wisdom, and the same view, the one who has the same qualities, the same teaching, the same way of living, the same training, the same practice, the same liberation, the same wisdom, the same view, and the same conduct, the one who has the same qualities, the same teaching, the same way of living, the same training, the same practice, the same liberation, the same wisdom, the same view, the same conduct, and the same practice of austerity, the one who has the same qualities, the same teaching, the same way of living, the same training, the same practice, the same liberation, the same wisdom, the same view, the same conduct, the same practice of austerity, and the same purity, the one who has the same qualities, the same teaching, the same way of living, the same training, the same practice, the same liberation, the same wisdom, the same view, the same conduct, the same practice of austerity, the same purity, and the same complete and pure spiritual life, they declare that such a one is a teacher.

original: dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manasānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
analyzed: dhammāḥ bahu ssutāḥ honti dhātā vacasā paricitāḥ manasā anupekkhitāḥ diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā
translated: and they proclaim a spiritual life that is fulfilled, purified, and completed, then he has learned much …🔽and penetrated by view.

original: Āraddhavīriyo viharati akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya, kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ upasampadāya, thāmavā daḷhaparakkamo anikkhittadhuro kusalesu dhammesu.
analyzed: āraddha vīriyaḥ viharati akusalānam dhammānam pahānāya kusalānam dhammānam upasampadāya thāmavā daḷha parakkamaḥ a nikkhitta dhuraḥ kusalesu dhammesu
translated: He lives energetically, giving up unwholesome things, undertaking wholesome things, steadfast, making strong effort, not shirking his duties in body, speech, and mind.

original: Satimā hoti, paramena satinepakkena samannāgato, cirakatampi cirabhāsitampi saritā anussaritā.
analyzed: satimā hoti paramena sati nepakkena samannāgato cirakatam pi cira bhāsitam pi saritā anussaritā
translated: He is mindful, possessing supreme mindfulness and alertness, remembering and recalling what was done and said a long time ago.

original: Paññavā hoti, udayatthagāminiyā paññāya samannāgato, ariyāya nibbedhikāya sammā dukkhakkhayagāminiyā.
analyzed: paññavā hoti udaya ttha gāminiyā paññāya samannāgataḥ ariyāya nibbedhikāya sammā dukkha kkhaya gāminiyā
translated: He is wise, possessing the wisdom that discerns arising and passing away, which is noble and penetrative and leads to the complete destruction of suffering.

original: Evaṁ kho, mahānāma, ariyasāvako sattahi saddhammehi samannāgato hoti.
analyzed: evam kho mahā nāma ariya sāvakaḥ sattahi saddhammehi samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: This, Mahanama, is how a noble disciple possesses seven good qualities.

original: Kathañca, mahānāma, ariyasāvako catunnaṁ jhānānaṁ ābhicetasikānaṁ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṁ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī?
analyzed: kathañca mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ catunnam jhānānam ābhicetasikānam diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihārānam nikāma lābhī hoti a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī
translated: “And how, Mahanama, does a noble disciple obtain at will, without trouble or difficulty, the four jhanas that constitute the higher mind and provide a pleasant abiding here and now?

original: Idha, mahānāma, ariyasāvako vivicceva kāmehi …pe… paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati;
analyzed: idha mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ vivicca iva kāmehi pe paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: “Here, Mahanama, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unwholesome states, a noble disciple enters and dwells in the first jhana, which consists of rapture and pleasure born of seclusion, accompanied by thought and examination.

original: vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā ajjhattaṁ sampasādanaṁ …pe… dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati;🔽pītiyā ca virāgā …pe… tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati;
analyzed: vitakka vicārānam vūpasamāḥ ajjhattam sampasādanam pe dutiyam jhānam upasampajja viharati  pītiyā ca virāgā pe tatiyam jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: With the subsiding of thought and examination, he enters and dwells in the second jhana, which has internal placidity and unification of mind and consists of rapture and pleasure born of concentration, without thought and examination.🔽With the fading away as well of rapture, he dwells equanimous and, mindful and clearly comprehending, he experiences pleasure with the body; he enters and dwells in the third jhana of which the noble ones declare: ‘He is equanimous, mindful, one who dwells happily?

original: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbeva somanassadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamā …pe… catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbā iva somanassa domanassānaṃ atthaṅgamā pe catuttham jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: With the abandoning of pleasure and pain, and with the previous passing away of joy and displeasure, he enters and dwells in the fourth jhana, neither painfull nor pleasant, which has purification of mindfulness by equanimity.

original: Evaṁ kho, mahānāma, ariyasāvako catunnaṁ jhānānaṁ ābhicetasikānaṁ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṁ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
analyzed: evam kho mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ catunnam jhānānam ābhicetasikānam diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihārānam nikāma lābhī hoti a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī
translated: “It is in such a way, Mahanama, that a noble disciple obtains at will, without trouble or difficulty, the four jhanas that constitute the higher mind and provide a pleasant abiding here and now.

original: Yato kho, mahānāma, ariyasāvako evaṁ sīlasampanno hoti, evaṁ indriyesu guttadvāro
analyzed: yatas kho mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ evam sīla sampannaḥ hoti evam indriyesu gutta dvāro
translated: and has thus become one who guards the sense doors,🔽and has thus become moderate in eating,🔽and has thus become devoted to wakefulness,

original: hoti, evaṁ bhojane mattaññū hoti, evaṁ jāgariyaṁ anuyutto hoti, evaṁ sattahi saddhammehi🔽samannāgato hoti, evaṁ catunnaṁ jhānānaṁ ābhicetasikānaṁ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṁ🔽nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī, ayaṁ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako sekho🔽pāṭipado apuccaṇḍatāya samāpanno, bhabbo abhinibbhidāya, bhabbo sambodhāya, bhabbo
analyzed: hoti evam bhojane mattaññū hoti evam jāgariyam anuyuttaḥ hoti evam sattahi saddhammehi  samannāgataḥ hoti evam catunnam jhānānam ābhicetasikānam diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihārānaṃ  nikāma lābhī hoti akiccha lābhī akasira lābhī ayam vuccati mahā nāma ariya sāvakaḥ sekho  pāṭipadaḥ a puccaṇḍa tāya samāpannaḥ bhabbaḥ abhinibbhidāya bhabbaḥ sambodhāya bhabbaḥ
translated: and has thus become endowed with seven good qualities,🔽and has thus become one who obtains at will, without trouble or difficulty, the four jhanas that constitute the higher mind and provide a pleasant abiding here and now,🔽then he is called a noble disciple who is in training, who has entered the path, a person of growing excellence, one who possesses right view, whose view is straight, who has confirmed confidence in the Dhamma, and who has arrived at the true Dhamma.

original: anuttarassa yogakkhemassa adhigamāya.
analyzed: anuttarassa yogakkhemassa adhigamāya
translated: He is incapable of doing any deed by reason of which he might be reborn in hell, in the animal realm, or in the domain of ghosts; he is incapable of passing away without having realized the fruit of stream-entry.

original: Seyyathāpi, mahānāma, kukkuṭiyā aṇḍāni aṭṭha vā dasa vā dvādasa vā tānāssu kukkuṭiyā🔽sammā adhisayitāni sammā pariseditāni sammā paribhāvitāni, kiñcāpi tassā kukkuṭiyā
analyzed: sā iyyathā api mahānāma kukkuṭiyāḥ aṇḍāni aṭṭha vā dasa vā dvādasa vā kukkuṭiyā  sammā adhisayitāni sammā pariseditāni sammā paribhāvitāni kiñca api tassā kukkuṭiyā
translated: Suppose, Mahanama, a hen has eight, ten, or twelve eggs, and she properly covers and incubates them.

original: na evaṁ icchā uppajjeyya:
analyzed: na evam icchā uppajjeyya
translated: Even though she may not wish and think:🔽‘Oh, that my chicks might pierce their shells with the points of their claws and beaks and hatch out safely!’

original: ‘aho vatime kukkuṭapotakā pādanakhasikhāya vā mukhatuṇḍakena vā aṇḍakosaṁ padāletvā sotthinā abhinibbhijjeyyun’ti,
analyzed: aho vati me kukkuṭa potakā pāda nakha sikhāya vā mukha tuṇḍakena vā aṇḍa kosam padāletvā sotthinā abhinibbhijjeyyunti
translated: ‘May these chicks break out of the eggshell with the points of their claws and beaks and come forth safely!’

original: atha kho bhabbāva te kukkuṭapotakā pādanakhasikhāya vā mukhatuṇḍakena vā aṇḍakosaṁ padāletvā sotthinā abhinibbhijjituṁ.
analyzed: atha kho bhabbāva te kukkuṭa potakā pāda nakha sikhāya vā mukha tuṇḍakena vā aṇḍa kosam padāletvā sotthinā abhinibbhijjitu
translated: Then the chicks are able to break out of the eggshell with the points of their claws and beaks and come forth safely.

original: Evameva kho, mahānāma, yato ariyasāvako evaṁ sīlasampanno hoti, evaṁ indriyesu guttadvāro
analyzed: evam eva kho mahānāma yatas ariya sāvakaḥ evam sīla sampannaḥ hoti evam indriyesu gutta dvāro
translated: So too, when a noble disciple has thus perfected his virtue, has thus guarded his sense faculties,

original: hoti, evaṁ bhojane mattaññū hoti, evaṁ jāgariyaṁ anuyutto hoti, evaṁ sattahi saddhammehi
analyzed: hoti evam bhojane mattaññū hoti evam jāgariyam anuyuttaḥ hoti evam sattahi saddhammehi
translated: has thus become moderate in eating, has thus devoted himself to wakefulness, has thus perfected his seven good dhammas,

original: samannāgato hoti, evaṁ catunnaṁ jhānānaṁ ābhicetasikānaṁ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṁ🔽nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī, ayaṁ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako sekho
analyzed: samannāgataḥ hoti evam catunnam jhānānam ābhicetasikānam diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihārānaṃ  nikāma lābhī hoti akiccha lābhī akasira lābhī ayam vuccati mahā nāma ariya sāvakaḥ sekho
translated: and has thus become one who obtains at will, without trouble or difficulty, the four jhanas that constitute the higher mind and provide a pleasant abiding here and now,🔽he is called a noble disciple who is a learner,

original: pāṭipado apuccaṇḍatāya samāpanno, bhabbo abhinibbhidāya, bhabbo sambodhāya, bhabbo
analyzed: pāṭipadaḥ a puccaṇḍa tāya samāpannaḥ bhabbaḥ abhinibbhidāya bhabbaḥ sambodhāya bhabbaḥ
translated: one who is training, one who is striving, one who is not subject to decline, one who is possessed of mindfulness and full awareness, one who has entered upon the way. He is capable of breaking out, of attaining the Deathless.

original: anuttarassa yogakkhemassa adhigamāya.
analyzed: anuttarassa yogakkhemassa adhigamāya
translated: for attaining the supreme security from bondage.

original: Sa kho so, mahānāma, ariyasāvako imaṁyeva anuttaraṁ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṁ āgamma anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati,
analyzed: sa kho saḥ mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ imayā iva anuttaram upekkhā sati pārisuddhim āgamma aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarati
translated: “Having approached this supreme seclusion of mindfulness through equanimity, a noble disciple recollects his manifold past abodes,

original: seyyathidaṁ—ekampi jātiṁ dvepi jātiyo …pe… iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati,
analyzed: sā iyyathidam ekam pi jātim dve pi jātiyaḥ pe iti sa ākāram sa uddesam aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarati
translated: that is, one birth, two five, ten fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand, many eons of cosmic contraction, many eons of cosmic expansion, many eons of cosmic contraction and expansion: ‘There I was so named, of such a clan, with such an appearance, such was my food, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such my life span;🔽passing away from there, I was reborn elsewhere; and there too I was so named, of such a clan, with such an appearance, such was my food, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such my life span; passing away from there, I was reborn here.’ Thus with its aspects and particulars, he recollects his manifold past abodes.

original: ayamassa paṭhamābhinibbhidā hoti kukkuṭacchāpakasseva aṇḍakosamhā.🔽Sa kho so, mahānāma, ariyasāvako imaṁyeva anuttaraṁ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṁ āgamma
analyzed: ayam assa paṭhamā abhinibbhidā hoti kukkuṭa chāpakassa iva aṇḍakosamhā  sa kho saḥ mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ imayā iva anuttaram upekkhā sati pārisuddhim āgamma
translated: This is his first breaking out like that of the hen’s chicks from their shells.

original: dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne
analyzed: dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne
translated: “Having approached this supreme seclusion of mindfulness through equanimity, a noble disciple, with his mind clear, purified, cleansed, spotless, free from defilements, malleable, workable, steady, impertubable, directs it to the knowledge of the passing away and arising of beings.

original: hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate …pe… yathākammūpage satte pajānāti,
analyzed: hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate pe yathā kammūpage satte pajānāti
translated: He sees beings passing away and arising: foul and lovely, happy and unhappy, lowly and exalted, and he understands how beings pass on according to their actions.

original: ayamassa dutiyābhinibbhidā hoti kukkuṭacchāpakasseva aṇḍakosamhā.
analyzed: ayam assa dutiyā abhinibbhidā hoti kukkuṭa chāpakassa iva aṇḍakosamhā
translated: This is his second breaking out like that of the hen’s chicks from their shells.

original: Sa kho so, mahānāma, ariyasāvako imaṁyeva anuttaraṁ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṁ āgamma🔽āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā
analyzed: sa kho saḥ mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ imayā iva anuttaram upekkhā sati pārisuddhim āgamma  āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā
translated: Having come to this unsurpassed deliverance of mind through equanimity,

original: sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati,
analyzed: sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati
translated: he, through the destruction of the taints, in this very life enters and dwells in the taintless liberation of mind, liberation by wisdom, realizing it for himself with direct knowledge.

original: ayamassa tatiyābhinibbhidā hoti kukkuṭacchāpakasseva aṇḍakosamhā.
analyzed: ayam assa tatiyā abhinibbhidā hoti kukkuṭa chāpakassa iva aṇḍakosamhā
translated: This is his third breaking out, like the hen’s chicks from their shells.

original: Yampi, mahānāma, ariyasāvako sīlasampanno hoti, idampissa hoti caraṇasmiṁ;
analyzed: yam pi mahānāma ariya sāvako sīla sampanno hoti idam pissa hoti caraṇasmi
translated: “Again, a noble disciple recollects the Dhamma thus:🔽‘The Dhamma is well proclaimed by the Blessed One, visible here and now, immediately effective, inviting inspection, onward leading, to be experienced by the wise for themselves.’

original: yampi, mahānāma, ariyasāvako indriyesu guttadvāro hoti, idampissa hoti caraṇasmiṁ;
analyzed: yampi mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ indriyesu gutta dvāraḥ hoti idam pissa hoti caraṇasmi
translated: When a noble disciple recollects the Dhamma, his mind becomes placid, joy arises, distress disappears, and his mind becomes concentrated.

original: yampi, mahānāma, ariyasāvako bhojane mattaññū hoti, idampissa hoti caraṇasmiṁ;🔽yampi, mahānāma, ariyasāvako jāgariyaṁ anuyutto hoti, idampissa hoti caraṇasmiṁ;
analyzed: yam pi mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ bhojane mattaññū hoti idam pissa hoti caraṇasmi  yam pi mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ jāgariyam anuyuttaḥ hoti idam pissa hoti caraṇasmi
translated: “Again, a noble disciple recollects the Sangha thus:🔽‘The Sangha of the Blessed One’s disciples who have practised well…🔽who have practised straight-forwardly…🔽who have practised methodically…

original: yampi, mahānāma, ariyasāvako sattahi saddhammehi samannāgato hoti, idampissa hoti caraṇasmiṁ;
analyzed: yam pi mahānāma ariyasāvakaḥ sattahi saddhammehi samannāgataḥ hoti idam pissa hoti caraṇasmi
translated: who have practised masterfully—🔽in other words, the four pairs of persons, the eight types of individuals, this Sangha of the Blessed One’s disciples is worthy of gifts, worthy of hospitality, worthy of offerings, worthy of reverential salutation, the unsurpassed field of merit for the world.’🔽When a noble disciple recollects the Sangha, his mind becomes placid, joy arises, distress disappears, and his mind becomes concentrated.

original: yampi, mahānāma, ariyasāvako catunnaṁ jhānānaṁ ābhicetasikānaṁ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṁ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī, idampissa hoti caraṇasmiṁ.🔽Yañca kho, mahānāma, ariyasāvako anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati, seyyathidaṁ—ekampi
analyzed: yam pi mahānāma ariyasāvakaḥ catunnam jhānānam ābhicetasikānam diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihārānam nikāma lābhī hoti akiccha lābhī akasira lābhī idam pissa hoti caraṇasmi  yat ca kho mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarati
translated: “And when a noble disciple recollects the deities, on that occasion his mind is not obsessed by lust, hatred, or delusion; on the contrary, he is on that occasion a person of limpid mind, a person of cleansed mind.🔽“When a noble disciple recollects his own virtues and recollects the deities, on that occasion his mind is not obsessed by lust, hatred, or delusion; on the contrary, he is on that occasion a person of limpid mind, a person of cleansed mind.🔽“When a noble disciple recollects his own virtues and recollects the deities, on that occasion his mind is not obsessed by lust, hatred, or delusion; on the contrary, he is on that occasion a person of limpid mind, a person of cleansed mind.

original: jātiṁ dvepi jātiyo …pe… iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati,🔽idampissa hoti vijjāya;🔽yampi, mahānāma, ariyasāvako dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte
analyzed: jātim dve api jātiyaḥ pe iti sa ākāram sa uddesam aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarati  idam pissa hoti vijjāya  yam pi mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena satte
translated: “When a noble disciple recollects his own virtues and recollects the deities, on that occasion his mind is not obsessed by lust, hatred, or delusion; on the contrary, he is on that occasion a person of limpid mind, a person of cleansed mind.🔽“When a noble disciple recollects his own virtues and recollects the deities, on that occasion his mind is not obsessed by lust, hatred, or delusion; on the contrary, he is on that occasion a person of limpid mind, a person of cleansed mind.🔽“When a noble disciple recollects his own virtues and recollects the deities, on that occasion his mind is not obsessed by lust, hatred, or delusion; on the contrary, he is on that occasion a person of limpid mind, a person of cleansed mind.

original: passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate …pe… yathākammūpage🔽satte pajānāti, idampissa hoti vijjāya.
analyzed: passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate pe yathākammūpage 🔽satte pajānāti idam pissa hoti vijjāya
translated: “When a noble disciple recollects his own virtues and recollects the deities, on that occasion his mind is not obsessed by lust, hatred, or delusion; on the contrary, he is on that occasion a person of limpid mind, a person of cleansed mind.🔽“When a noble disciple recollects his own virtues and recollects the deities, on that occasion his mind is not obsessed by lust, hatred, or delusion; on the contrary, he is on that occasion a person of limpid mind,

original: Yampi, mahānāma, ariyasāvako āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati, idampissa hoti vijjāya.
analyzed: yam pi mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati idam pissa hoti vijjāya
translated: “When a noble disciple, through the destruction of the taints, has realized for himself with direct knowledge, in this very life, the taintless liberation of mind, liberation by wisdom, and having entered upon it, he abides in it, this is his knowledge of the destruction of the taints.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako vijjāsampanno itipi caraṇasampanno itipi vijjācaraṇasampanno itipi.
analyzed: ayam vuccati mahānāma ariya sāvako vijjā sampannaḥ iti pi caraṇa sampannaḥ iti pi vijjā caraṇa sampannaḥ iti pi
translated: This is called a noble disciple who is perfect in view, perfect in conduct, perfect in wisdom, and perfect in the destruction of the taints.

original: Brahmunāpesā, mahānāma, sanaṅkumārena gāthā bhāsitā:
analyzed: brahmunāpesā mahā nāma sanaṅkumārena gāthā bhāsitā
translated: “Mahānāma, this verse was also recited by the brahmā Sanankumāra:

original: ‘Khattiyo seṭṭho janetasmiṁ,
analyzed: khattiyaḥ seṭṭhaḥ janetasmi
translated: ‘The warrior-noble is the best among men

original: ye gottapaṭisārino;
analyzed: ye gotta paṭisārino
translated: who are obsessed with lineage;

original: Vijjācaraṇasampanno,
analyzed: vijjā ācaraṇa sampannaḥ
translated: But one endowed with knowledge and conduct is best

original: so seṭṭho devamānuse’ti.
analyzed: so seṭṭhaḥ deva mānusa iti
translated: among gods and humans.’

original: Sā kho panesā, mahānāma, brahmunā sanaṅkumārena gāthā sugītā no duggītā, subhāsitā no dubbhāsitā, atthasaṁhitā no anatthasaṁhitā, anumatā bhagavatā”ti.
analyzed: sā kho pana isā mahānāma brahmunā sanaṅkumārena gāthā su gītā no duggītā su bhāsitā no dubbhāsitā attha sahitā no anattha sahitā anumatā bhagavatā ati
translated: “Mahānāma, this verse was well sung by the brahmā Sanankumāra, not wrongly sung; it was well spoken, not wrongly spoken; it has a meaning, and is not meaningless; and it was approved by the Lord Buddha.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā uṭṭhahitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā uṭṭhahitvā āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: Then the Lord, rising from his seat, addressed the venerable Ānanda, saying:

original: “sādhu sādhu, ānanda,
analyzed: sādhu sādhu ānanda
translated: “Good, Ānanda, good!

original: sādhu kho tvaṁ, ānanda, kāpilavatthavānaṁ sakyānaṁ sekhaṁ pāṭipadaṁ abhāsī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu khalu tvaḥ ānanda kāpilavatthavānam sakyānam sekham pāṭipadam abhāsi iti
translated: It’s good that you’ve spoken about the training of the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu.”

original: Idamavocāyasmā ānando.
analyzed: idam avoca ayasmai ānandaḥ
translated: The Buddha said this,

original: Samanuñño satthā ahosi.
analyzed: samanuññaḥ satthā ahosi
translated: and the Teacher approved.

original: Attamanā kāpilavatthavā sakyā āyasmato ānandassa bhāsitaṁ abhinandunti.
analyzed: attamanāḥ kāpilavatthavāḥ sakyāḥ āyasmataḥ ānandassa bhāsitam abhinandunti
translated: The Sakyans of Kapilavatthu were satisfied and delighted in the Venerable Ānanda’s words.

original: Sekhasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: sekha suttam niṭṭhitam tatiya
translated: The third section for recitation on the training is finished.
